text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

text: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
author: Buddha

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Speak when you are angry, and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Anger is just anger. It isn't good. It isn't bad. It just is. What you do with it is what matters.
author: Jim Butcher

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: Anger is an energy.
author: John Lydon

text: When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, a hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Anger, if not restrained, is frequently more hurtful to us than the injury that provokes it.
author: Seneca

text: Anger is an emotion, and emotions are fluid. They can be anything and everything at once.
author: Jhene Aiko

text: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

text: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before - it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

text: Anger is a natural response to feelings of hurt, betrayal, and embarrassment, among others.
author: Bryant H. McGill

text: Anger is often more hurtful than the injury that caused it.
author: Unknown

text: Bitterness is like cancer. It eats upon the host. But anger is like fire. It burns it all clean.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The worst tempered people I have ever met were those who knew that they were wrong.
author: David Letterman

text: Anger is one letter short of danger.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: Anybody can become angry - that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way - that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
author: Aristotle

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: The more anger towards the past you carry in your heart, the less capable you are of loving in the present.
author: Barbara De Angelis

text: A man is about as big as the things that make him angry.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Anger is an emotion that can be controlled through conscious effort and practice.
author: Valerie J. Lewis Coleman

text: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you are.
author: Cherie Carter-Scott

text: Anger and fear are the two emotions that bring out the worst in people.
author: Nelson DeMille

text: Anger is just a cowardly extension of sadness. It's a lot easier to be angry at someone than it is to tell them you're hurt.
author: Tom Gates

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Confucius

text: Holding on to anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
author: Buddha

text: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: Anger is often more hurtful than the injury that caused it.
author: Unknown

text: Anger is an energy that can destroy or create.
author: John Lydon

text: Don’t hold to anger, hurt or pain. They steal your energy and keep you from love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness. When you feel it coming, turn your focus to your breath.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.
author: Mohandas Gandhi

text: Anger is a temporary madness.
author: Horace

text: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you are.
author: Cherie Carter-Scott

text: Anger is only one letter short of danger.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you want to conquer the world, you must first conquer your own anger.
author: Confucius

text: It’s important to feel your feelings, but it’s also important not to let your feelings control you.
author: Unknown

text: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.
author: George Eliot

text: Anger is like a boomerang, it always comes back.
author: Unknown

text: Anger is an emotion, not a behavior.
author: Lundy Bancroft

text: Sometimes we get angry, not because of what others say or do, but because of what we expect from them.
author: Unknown

text: When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Anger is often a signal that something needs to change.
author: Unknown

text: The angrier you get, the tighter the handcuffs get.
author: Jesse Ventura

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Unknown

text: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

text: Anger is often what pain looks like when it shows itself in public.
author: Krista Tippett

text: The first step in managing anger is to admit that you are angry.
author: Unknown

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: Anybody can become angry – that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way – that is not within everybody’s power and is not easy.
author: Aristotle

text: Anger is an emotion, not a weapon.
author: Unknown
